div.bibl: Interview with Rev. Shevchuk by Dmitri Stranden REV. SHEVCHUK'S BIOGRAPHY

body.p: Ilya Fedorovich Shevchuck was born in in the village of Symonovichi, country of , province of , Russia. his father was a farmer. He attended a parochial school for three years. In 1911 he emigrated to America. While still living in Russia, in he was converted to the faith. When he to the United States he came straight to Chicago. he found employment with the Pennsylvania Railroad. Later he studied at the Institute and completed his studies there in 1915. In order to make a living he worked for the Company and for the Simon Saw and Steel Company. He joined the Chicago Russian community of Christians and attended classes at Berg's , Public and High School, at Hoyne St. near Division St.

In 1920 and 1930 he visited the province of (which after the Russian
had become a part of Poland) and while staying there married a Russian girl. They have a son and a daughter. They boy will soon be of school age, and meanwhile the parents are sending him to a kindergarten.
